### **SCENE SETTING:**
The office breakroom — daytime, artificial and natural mixed lighting from windows and overhead fixtures.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark vest - brown, medium-length hair - concerned/animated expression
Unidentified person: dark-colored top - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - smiling expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Chandler sits at a table, eating from a cup while reading a magazine. An unidentified woman in a red patterned dress enters, holding a mug, and begins talking animatedly to Chandler, gesturing with her hands. Chandler reacts with surprise and concern, looking up at her as she moves around the room. The scene cuts to a montage of the Friends cast in various settings, including a bar and a living room.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Yogurt cup: white (on table)
- Magazine: open (on table)
- Coffee mug: white (held by unidentified person)
- Water cooler: silver (in background)
- Refrigerator: white (in background)
- Whiteboard: with writing (on wall)
- Chairs: light-colored (around table)
- Sofa: beige (in background)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
The unidentified person discusses a potential date with Chandler, mentioning a man who is "cute" and "funny." The conversation has a casual, slightly humorous tone, with the unidentified person appearing enthusiastic and Chandler reacting with surprise and concern. The dialogue suggests a lighthearted but slightly awkward interaction.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Unidentified person enters frame from the right side and walks toward Chandler.
Chandler looks up from his yogurt cup and reacts to the conversation.
Scene cuts to a montage of the Friends cast.
chunk_00001.subtitles: Hey, gorgeous. How's it going? Dehydrated Japanese noodles under fluorescent lights. Does it get better than this? Question: You're not dating, are you? I met somebody who would be perfect for you. You see, perfect might be a problem. Had you said co-dependent or self-destructive... - You want a date Saturday? - Yes, please. He is cute. - He's funny. He's... - He's a he? Well, yeah. Oh, God. I just... You're nice... Oh, God. Good, Shelly. Okay. I'm gonna go flush myself down the toilet now. Okay. Bye-bye.
chunk_00001.episode: 1x08 - The One Where Nana Dies Twice

chunk_00002.subtitles: CHANDLER: It's hard to enjoy noodles after that. Is that ridiculous? Can you believe she actually thought that? Um... Yeah. Well, when I first met you, I thought maybe... ...possibly... ...you might be. You did? Then you spent Phoebe's birthday party talking to my breasts...

You're kidding. - Did you tell her I wasn't? - No. It's because I wanted to go out with her too. So I told her, actually, you were seeing Bernie Spellman... ...who also liked her. Ross Geller: dark-colored shirt - light-colored pants - dark, curly hair - serious

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller is sitting in a chair, talking animatedly to Monica Geller, who is seated across from him. Monica listens, smiling and nodding, occasionally responding. Ross gestures with his hands as he speaks. The conversation appears to be serious but with moments of levity.

- Framed picture (on wall behind Ross)
- Quilted bedspread (on bed)
- Lamp (on side table)
- Books (stacked on table)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses his wish to be buried at sea after death with Monica Geller. The conversation has a serious yet slightly humorous tone, with Ross appearing earnest and Monica reacting with a mix of concern and amusement.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**

Monica Geller turns to face Ross as he speaks.
Ross Geller sits back down after retrieving the item.
chunk_00010.subtitles: ROSS: Here's my retainer. I was just thinking... ...when my time comes... - Dad. Listen to me. When my time comes, I wanna be buried at sea. You what? I wanna be buried at sea. It looks like fun. Define "fun." Come on. You'll make a day of it. You'll get a boat, pack a lunch... And then we throw your body in the water. Gee, that does sound fun. Everyone thinks they know me. Everyone says, "Jack Geller, so predictable." Maybe after I'm gone, they'll say, "Buried at sea? Huh." That's probably what they'll say.
chunk_00010.episode: 1x08 - The One Where Nana Dies Twice

chunk_00017.subtitles: Hi, I'm Andrea. I'm Dorothy's daughter. Hi, I'm Chandler, and I have no idea who Dorothy is. PHOEBE: Hey, look who's up. - Hey. - How do you feel? [CHUCKLES] I feel great. chunk_00019.subtitles: Your grandmother would've hated this. Well, sure. What with it being her funeral and all. No, I'd be hearing about... ...why didn't I get the honey-glazed ham? Or I didn't spend enough on flowers. If I spent more, she'd say: "Why waste your money? I don't need flowers, I'm dead." That sounds like Nana. Do you know what it's like to grow up... ...with someone who is critical of every single thing you say? I can imagine. I tell you, it's a wonder your mother turned out... ...to be the positive, life-affirming person she is. That is a wonder. So tell me something, Mom. If you had to do it all over again... ...I mean, if she was here right now... ...would you tell her?

chunk_00020.subtitles: Tell her what? How she drove you crazy, picking on every little detail. Like your hair, for example. I'm not sure I know what you're getting at. Would things have been better if you'd just told her the truth? No. I think some things are better left unsaid. I think it's nicer when people just get along. Ha. More wine, dear? Oh, I think so.
